summary: eukaryotic cells are cytoplasmic foci composed of stalled translation preinitiation complexes. they are postulated to play a critical role in regulating mRNA metabolism during stress via so-called “mRNA triage” (2). eIF2 reduces the amount of eIF2-GTP-tRNA complex and inhibits translation initiation. domain-binding protein (G3BP) is self-oligomerized with the stalled initiation factors. SG assembly begins with the simultaneous formation of numerous small mRNP granules. aggregation of TIA-1 or TIAR is regulated by molecular chaperones. stress-induced translational arrest plays an important role in host antiviral defense. vaccinia virus induces cytoplasmic “factories” in which viral translation, replication, and assembly take place. these factories include G3BP and Caprin-1 to promote transcription of viral mRNA (11). the genus Flavivirus belongs to the family Flaviviridae. a mutant JEV carrying a core protein incapable of binding to Caprin-1 exhibited lower propagation in vitro and lower pathogenicity in mice. these results reveal a novel strategy of JEV to inhibit SG formation through an interaction with Caprin-1 and facilitate viral propagation. cDNA of human Caprin-1 was amplified by reverse transcription-PCR. cloned into pCAGPM-N-HA (20) and pGEX 6P-1 (GE Healthcare, Buckinghamshire, United Kingdom) cDNAs of human G3BP1 and USP10 were also amplified by RT-PCR. all plasmids were confirmed by sequencing with an ABI Prism 3130 genetic analyzer. mammalian cell lines, Vero (African green monkey kidney), 293T (human kidney), Huh7 (human hepatocellular carcinoma) and HeLa (human cervical carcinoma) were maintained in Dulbecco's modified Eagle's minimal essential medium (DMEM) anti-JEV core rabbit polyclonal antibody (PAb) and anti-JEV NS3 mouse monoclonal antibody (MAb) were prepared as described previously (20, 23) anti-DENV core protein rabbit PAb was prepared by using a GST-fused protein containing amino acid residues 2 to 100 of the DENV core protein. anti-FLAG mouse MAb (M2) and rabbit PAb and anti-actin mouse MAb were purchased from Sigma.
